website_summaries.verdict: If your cat loves "brothy" food, this is the one to choose – most cats can't resist its savory aroma and hearty ingredients. The trade off is the smaller portion size per pouch.
pros: Crafted with tuna, shrimp, vegetables, and whitefish pieces packed in silky or creamy broths
Easy to mix with kibble for picky eaters, and it's a good choice for older cats with dental issues
cons: Costlier than other varieties on our list – each pouch contains 1.4 oz

customer_reviews.title: Best price in my neighborhood and free delivery too!!
customer_reviews.text: My 18 year old cat Bella, was sick with end stage kidney disease. I fed her Fancy Feast Broths anytime she wanted one. Bella loved these broths especially the Classic flavor. I liked the fact that Amazon was cheaper than any of the grocery stores I live around. Thank you to Amazon for keeping their prices down and continuing to deliver for free. You helped me keep my Bella happy during her final weeks of life! And, for that I thank you very much. Very Sincerely, Mommare Dunn
customer_reviews.author: Mommare Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Messy to open
customer_reviews.text: Like a previous reviewer, our cats would give this product five stars. They love it. We're not sure there's much nutrition with all the sauce, but nothing gets wasted. For us, three stars is generous, for two reasons. First, these packages are a pain to open and dispense, squirting the liquid all over when torn open, regardless of how careful. We have to open them in the sink to avoid the mess. And getting all of the solid food out of the packet is near impossible. For a buck or more for these small packets, one would think the smart people at Fancy Feast could come up with a more user-friendly package.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Hanz

customer_reviews.title: Zane Loves It
customer_reviews.text: He is thirteen years old and in stage 3 renal failure and is hungry all the time but fussy about what I put in front of him. He loves these pouch food and eats one every three hours round the clock. What I like about them, bsides the fact that he loves them, is that they are quiet. I can open one of these and feed him and the other cats don't hear it as they would when I opened a can of food.
customer_reviews.author: G. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Magic if you need to hide medicine in your cat's food
customer_reviews.text: I have to give one of my cats medicine twice a day, probably for the rest of his life. I can mix the meds in his food but he is an indifferent eater so it was challenging to be sure he got all his medication down. This stuff is like magic. He DEMANDS it twice a day and even grabs at his bottle of medicine bc he associates it with the Fancy Feast broth. And he licks up every drop so I don't have to worry about undermeficating him. This stuff isn't cheap but it has cut my stress immensely and decreased emergency vet trips to zero -- worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: CatLover

customer_reviews.title: Helpful and only way to give a cat medicine
customer_reviews.text: My cat has to take asthma pills every morning and night. This is no easy task and we tried everything from pill pocket treats to sneaking it in her food to forcing it by hand, which stressed her out even more. I mix a small amount of liquid from a pouch w the crushed pills and shoot it into her mouth using a syringe. She tastes fish, which she loves and i know she actually kept down her medicine. I store the open pouch in a ziplock baggie in the fridge. The liquid from one pouch gets me through the week and at the end of the week she gets the actual meat within the pouch as a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Forfa

customer_reviews.title: This is great if you have a cat that is refusing to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you have a cat that is refusing to eat. They will most likely eat (or should I say drink?) this. It's is overpriced considering all you get is one chunk of meat and a bunch of liquid, so I don't recommend this as a regular food for your cat. But when my cats aren't feeling good, they will usually still eat this so I keep a supply on hand just in case (I foster kittens and cats, in addition to having an 16 y/o who can be picky, so it's important to make sure everyone is eating).
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Contains sugar and milk, 2 things cats should NEVER have
customer_reviews.text: Check the ingredients. Don't feed your cat anything that a cat in the wild would not eat. There are fillers in here but worse than that, SUGAR which is terrible and deadly for cats and MILK which an adult weaned cat is lactose intolerant so should NEVER have milk. Plus things like tomato? Cats don't eat tomatoes! They care more about marketing to you than what is right for your cat. I read the ingredients unfortunately after I gave this to my cats and they threw up. That prompted me to pay more attention and saw that list of ingredients which just floors me. This is cat poison.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Smith

customer_reviews.title: 22 YEAR OLD KITTY LOVES THESE BROTHS!
customer_reviews.text: My 22 year old cat had been ill and wasn't eating very well. I tried a variety of foods to encourage her appetite and hit on the Fancy Feast Broths that she loved. She is pretty much back to normal eating habits but I still give this to her once a day as a special treat for a special girl.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth woodard

customer_reviews.title: Miss Squish Loves These Little Packets Of Goodness
customer_reviews.text: My cat has decided that these little packets of broth and fish are the most delicious things to eat. She would request one every day or two, but now it’s a daily thing for her to sit in front of the pantry and meow until I retrieve one for her. And her beautiful fluffy coat seems to have gotten even more beautiful since she’s started eating these daily. They’ve become a good compliment to her regular dry food.
customer_reviews.author: Michelegg

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: All four of my fur babies love this! The photo says it all!!
customer_reviews.author: karen alexander

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: If your cat licks out all of the liquid from their normal cat food like mine you’ll like these. Just enough liquid to satisfy and they actually eat some of the tuna/fish chunks too. The quantity in each package is just right for feeding one kitty and so little is leftover! Worth every penny as I use to throw away 1/2 a can, even the small ones, because my cats would not eat solids. Takes up less space in trash and easy-peasy to serve to my finicky babies.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this broth. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the price. It is expensive. It comes in a pouch that can be shared between 2 cats. But it is more of a snack than an entire meal. My maincoon just eats the broth. My tabby loves the broth and chunks of meat. He will finish the maincoon meat. The variety of flavors is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Cats eat it and that's all that matters
customer_reviews.text: My cats only like the creamy broths, But they mostly lick the broth and don't eat the actual meat. I gave this four stars because one of my cats is very picky and has liver issues and I worry that she doesn't eat enough. So this is usually what I pull out to get her to eat something, but I don't know how nutritious it is to just lick the broth.
customer_reviews.author: Polka loves Polka Dancing

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat went crazy over it the first time I gave her the packet. She licked up the broth first and then gobbled up the meat part. My box contained 3 different flavors. I found that she was crazy about all the broths. As for the one with the anchovies: she did leave behind the anchovy fishes so I guess she didn't like the fish too much. But that didn't stop her from gobbling up everything else. It was hilarious watching her go back after she finished to go and lick the bowl again! Now everyday she meows and carries on for her "snack". I definitely recommend this for cat owners!
customer_reviews.author: Cameogirl

customer_reviews.title: a favorite
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these packets and sometimes it is just the right amount of food. My only complaint is that it can be hard to get every bit out of the narrow packet. Suggest they make it so after you empty you can fully open to expose the inside and get it all out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Nucci

customer_reviews.title: All 3 cats love this as a snack! Cheaper on Amazon than most retail stores!
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my cats love these! If I would let them, they would eat these for their daily meal. They just don't have enough nutrients and can be a little pricey overall. They seem to enjoy every flavor with the chicken & vegetable being their least favorite. The one they like the most is the creamy tuna and they do like Anchovies and Shrimp a ton. Amazon is the cheapest for these flavors unless a retail store has them on sale. These arrived in fine condition and are a hit with the kitties, like usual. These come highly recommended and easily get 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: J.R. (Not from Dallas)

customer_reviews.title: ADDICTIVE !!️
customer_reviews.text: !!️BE AWARE! ADDICTIVE TO CATS! !!️☢️ This product makes your cat crazy! The product contains sugar and is very bad for your pet! It sells like food but it’s more like treat! After even the first time I gave it to my cat - he start acting weird, he was meowing and refusing to eat his regular food for days! Please consider all this before you start giving this “food” to your cats!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mariya

customer_reviews.title: Enticing, fancy broths
customer_reviews.text: My elderly kitty loves these, and she licks all the broth, but leaves the "meaty bits". Sometimes my other cats will finish for her, and sometimes not. I know they don't provide full nutrition, but it's difficult for her to eat other more solid foods. This is a nice way to get her to eat something. My one complaint is the high price for these. They are mostly broth, for Pete's sake! Anyway, they save me from having to make my own (which I've tried and my cats just don't like it). I guess there's something in these that makes them irresistible.
customer_reviews.author: K-

customer_reviews.title: Shes a happy camper!
customer_reviews.text: If you're using this as a main source of food, you're starving your cat. The amount in each bag is about a tablespoon of broth n usually just white fish, no shrimp. I use this as a treat rather than meal. Once a week only. I do have to say it's pleasant in smell n the cat loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Old Retired Artist n pastry Chef

customer_reviews.title: Senior Ragdoll - has decided to eat fish 🐠
customer_reviews.text: My ragdoll muffin is 18 years old and has eaten chicken her whole life - randomly tried this and she went crazy for it - I’ll continue to buy for her as she eats every single ounce of it! I bought this brand and one other brand both seem to be her favorite food ever!
customer_reviews.author: Pepper Potts

customer_reviews.title: Messy Packaging Friskies Lil Soups are much better
customer_reviews.text: I tried these because they are a slightly bigger portion size compared to Friskies Lil Soups. However, that's just not enough to make me purchase again. The packaging is like a tuna pouch, but even when massaged before opening it's very difficult to get all of it out. You make a mess trying to. Also, it's truly a broth and not creamy like Lil Soups and my cats just didn't like it as much. Just my cats preference, others may find differently. My cats are Lil Soup addicts now.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Spring

customer_reviews.title: Dogs have owners. Cats have staff.
customer_reviews.text: My life would be simpler if my cat would just drink water and stay hydrated. I use these with a sprinkle of miralax so my cat doesn't get constipated. This is what I'm doing here on Earth: checking to see if my cat's poop is sticky enough.
customer_reviews.author: Austinite

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it way more than I do
customer_reviews.text: If my cat were writing this review, the product would get 5 stars. She loves it. Me? I’m being generous at two stars — this is without a doubt the worst packaged, most expensive cat food on the planet. The pouch isn’t easy to tear open, and when you do, the broth is very apt to slosh out on the countertop or even spray over your kitchen cabinets. And while the broth is tasty (says my cat), it is basically flavored water. The amount of solid food is laughable. And at a buck or better per pouch, it’s stupidly expensive. S
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fetherston

customer_reviews.title: My cat LOVES this!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat only wantS to eat the broth from her wet food (she’s fine w/her dry food. She’s just very picky!). I was looking for a cat food that had a lot of gravy, and this was it! My cat absolutely loves it. She eats all of it- the fish pieces and the broth (*Note- the fish pieces are REAL! I was not expecting to see actual anchovies or shrimp in the packets. The anchovies are whole).. But knowing how much she loves it I do my best to not focus on the little anchovies staring at me as I prepare the cat dish...lol
customer_reviews.author: LSFL

customer_reviews.title: Not meant to be a meal but provided something extra for my older cat.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older cat that seems to love the gravy on food and I wanted to be able to provide him a little extra moisture in his diet. He loves the gravy, leaves some of the small pieces that are it, but the other cat comes along and eats those pieces! This is NOT a meal, it’s just a little treat and provides a little more for my older cat. I wish I could just find a bottle of something similar to pour on his regular food, but this helps.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Francis

customer_reviews.title: Cat junkie
customer_reviews.text: Cat got addicted to special morning treat supplement for a few months - like it was feline heroin! She started waking me up way too early DEMANDING a fix. After intervention quit cold turkey. Besides, she puked on carpet several x after devouring the product. Far too rich for my recovering calico friend.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnycat

customer_reviews.title: Only thing she will.eat...
customer_reviews.text: FF chicken broths (not the creamy ones) are litterly the only thing my cat will eat. FF has 2 non creamy chicken varieties that are her only meals. Won't eat any human food, not tuna, not milk, not treats, NOTHING, but an occasional frog if it gets in. She loves FF. Theses are not made to be the only food, but what do you do when cat goes 3 days without eating? Only downfalls with the FF broths are they are VERY expensive for the amount of product you get. In additon, in local stores, these 2 flavors are hard to find. What's a kitty's human supposed to do? Buy FF online of course.
customer_reviews.author: secbnc

customer_reviews.title: Great as an occasional treat
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, and they all love these broths. They do not have many calories per packet, so obviously these aren't meant to be their main source of food. But it's a great "complement" to their food, as the package says. I mix it in their food a few times a week. I think it also keeps their coats smooth and soft! This is also great for elderly kitties who can't eat solid food very easily, or have weak appetites.
customer_reviews.author: Vanya

customer_reviews.title: All four cats love Fancy Feast Broths
customer_reviews.text: Judging by the way my cats push each other out of the way when these broths are in the bowls, I'd guess they're pretty delicious. All of my cats seem to like all of the flavors. I bought these to try to get extra calories into my skinny elderly cat, but if I don't watch carefully, she hardly gets any of it before someone else takes it away from her. My only complaint is the price. This is just a meal supplement so $1 per pouch makes it too expensive for everyday, but it's a great occasional treat.
customer_reviews.author: schnappsersTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Fancy Feast
customer_reviews.text: If wet cat food could be acknowledged as the true description cat crack that expresses the sheer intense wild consumption cats exhibit in devouring this brand and flavors. My cats are 11+ and like another reviewer said fountain of youth turned their cat into a whimsical and quirky kittendom pandemonium. I could hardly open the pouch to hurridly dish to my kids but I had to battle to permit me to dump the pouch in their bowls. They paced they hovered and were relentless needing their fix. At night they both are so loving, smooth silky furr, vivid bright shiny eyes, and graciously affectionate and happy. A definite continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic alternative treat for a cat
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled by this -- and most importantly, so is my cat. My cat periodically (every month or so) has a digestive upset where he totally stops eating (but still drinks water) for almost 2 weeks during which he throws up fluid, and then resumes eating and having bowel movements for another month or so (two vets can't diagnose this). I tried this new broth to see it I can tempt him to eat something during this "fasting" period, and he literally went crazy consuming this broth. I'm very happy that he's getting some nourishment (even if it isn't a balanced diet) during this fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C

customer_reviews.title: They're perfect for what I want - mostly moisture
customer_reviews.text: So.... for some reason my cat will ONLY eat seafood flavored food. She gets dry food in the morning but I wanted to make sure she gets enough water (I've been down the kidney failure road with previous cats ) so I give her one of these broths every night and she's a total fiend for it! They're perfect for what I want - mostly moisture, small amount (she didn't need more calories) and she loves them. Really nice that they come in pouches too, so it takes up minimal space.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Favorite In-Between Meal Snack
customer_reviews.text: My cats often give me the love-eyes treatment while pawing at their food dishes. Well, I know what that means - time for an in-between meal snack. Both my cats love munching on dry food, but it's not the healthiest thing going as a permanent snack, so I give them each a half-packet of the broth as a treat. They absolutely love the broth and the sizeable fish bits in the broth; their fave flavor being the clear broth with tuna, shrimp, and whitefish. The amount of fish in the broth is just enough to quell their hunger....and the broth is lapped up in seconds. Good job.
customer_reviews.author: Katsnjabber

customer_reviews.title: My finicky cat likes this
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Siamese cat that doesn't like canned cat food but needs to get more liquid in her diet. So I have been making the rounds of all the broth products, even going so far as making bone broth from scratch (she wouldn't touch it). She likes the pouch broth products but won't eat the meat that comes with it. I wish they made a broth-only product. This is the first creamy broth product that I have bought and was skeptical about her liking it, but she prefers this to the clear broth ones. Don't know why, but as long as she likes it, I will buy it.
customer_reviews.author: ccsteveTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not a full case, 10 packets in plain box
customer_reviews.text: This was not a store packages case... it wasn’t even a full case! I got 10 packets in a plain cardboard box for full price. I’m disappointed I can’t return this.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Ummmmmm (from my cat)
customer_reviews.text: Well, my cat selects her meal, and for the past several years a bit of the Fancy Feast Broth with tuna, shrimp, white fish in a decadent seafood broth is her favorite. I give her about a tablespoon full twice a day with her solid food. It stimulates her appetite, and "primes" her to continue what I consider her health solid food. I have tried other Fancy Feast flavor pouches, but she insists on this specific flavor. I dread the day Fancy Feast decides to "improve" their formula, and change their mix. Yes, I would recommend this to a cat!
customer_reviews.author: DeaN4U2C

customer_reviews.title: My Boys Love It
customer_reviews.text: My cat Cookie knows that I sometimes give him this in the afternoon especially if he has been outside. I swear he goes out and comes in to see if I will get it for him. He goes to the cupboard where I keep it. Since it is a bit pricey, I don't give it every day. But when I do, it looks fresh, smells great, and they (I make him share with my other spoiled brat) eat every bit, unlike the 'lick the gravy off' behavior I see with some other foods. I believe in spoiling my cats; they are with us for such a short time. And this food helps me do that.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie B

customer_reviews.title: Work hard to get it all out.
customer_reviews.text: I feed my cat the only dry food she will eat, Rachael Ray. But I give her a pack of this daily for hydration. The portions are so small and hard to get all out of the package, so I empty as much as I can in the bowl, fill packet half full of water, clamp it shut and shake it up real hard getting most of the rest out. Given the price per packet for the small amount makes this a very expensive treat or food additive. By mixing mine with water it makes it a broth with enough flavor that my cat has not seemed to miss.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love This
customer_reviews.text: Speaking for the cats, "Meowwww, give me more!" They both love these. Just the right size to split between the two cats. Of course they try to "talk" us into giving them more throughout the day. We keep them for special treats, like after brushing, or nail clipping. It makes they happy to anticipate what's coming and much more cooperative.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: When kitty is happy, all are happy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20y.o. cat with a couple missing teeth, totally blind at this point, yet feisty, finicky appetite. With a heightened sense of smell he refuses to eat anything that does not pass his smell- taste test. The broths selections-varieties meet the current challenge. When kitty is happy, all are happy! Amazon, thanks for the variety, selections for this brand... be able to buy in bulk.
customer_reviews.author: samanthame

customer_reviews.title: kitty crack
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a bit of a diva and she eats only a certain brand, which is fancy feast, the wet food with the whole shrimp. when i put this in her bowl, she immediately walks over and buries her face and laps up all the broth. normally, she follows me around like a puppy and this is the only time i can get away from her. it's my little trick that i use and thankfully, cats are food driven and that takes over her need to be stuck to me. it doesn't happen with her regular food, just this broth.
customer_reviews.author: americancarol

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky cats of all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats love this flavor, by far their favorite flavor in the Broths! My older cat is 13+ yrs old, and my younger cat is 3+ yrs old. I normally feed them 1/2 small can of cat food per meal, but with these I give them each their own packet. They also eat other brands of dry kibble and treats throughout the day, but this is one of their fav wet foods by far. I would recommend this for picky cats, both of mine love this stuff! Grat for cats that love gravy too!
customer_reviews.author: Angel K

customer_reviews.title: Imagine my shock!!
customer_reviews.text: I opened a packet and poured the 'broth' into a bowl for our cat and there it was! An entire little fishy, eyes and all, laying there waiting for my kitty. I was really shocked lol! There's no doubt that this food is NOT packed with fillers. She loves it. And the pricing here definitely makes me buy it on Amazon and not at the local grocery store.
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth

customer_reviews.title: Great for giving your pet crushable medicine
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the Broths. She loves the broth of chicken but will not eat the rubbery chicken pieces. She will eat the fish pieces in those Broths types. My main use for the FF Broths is to deliver medicine to my little kitty. The medicine is reported to be bitter tasting but she loves the liquid in these packets so much that she ignores, or doesn’t taste, the medicine. I crush the pills in the liquid. The Broths have taken away the anxiety I used to feel when giving her a pill.
customer_reviews.author: NancyB

customer_reviews.title: My old cat is obsessed with this
customer_reviews.text: I have a sweet old man cat and he sometimes doesn’t feel like eating his hard food (teeth are fine he’s just picky). I bought this to make sure he’s getting enough nutrition and he literally gobbles this up like no other business! Smells and looks disgusting but cats LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica B.

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure why they won't eat the meat but the classic and creamy broths get slurped up pretty quickly. I wish there was a liquid only ...
customer_reviews.text: my cats eat most of the broths up but continuously leave the fish and "chunky" items behind. I'm not sure why they won't eat the meat but the classic and creamy broths get slurped up pretty quickly. I wish there was a liquid only option so I wouldn't be wasting any food.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Sage & Poppy’s favorite meal
customer_reviews.text: My 2 kitties love THIS flavor of THIS wet food better than any other. It’s actually the only one they’ll finish - now the only one I buy. Most wet foods aren’t wet enough for them, and they really like how soupy this is. Buying it here costs less than at my grocery store, plus the flavor I need is always in stock.
customer_reviews.author: E. Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat with kidney disease
customer_reviews.text: Smells awful and after eating so does his breath ,but my cat loves it! I bought it because he needs to gain weight as he has kidney disease. He hates fish but loves this! I read that this was in the list for things that help cats gain weight. The other items on the list were weird gels and pastes and some people claimed the products killed their pets! This seemed like a safe alternative and he seems happy. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Mw

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Cats LOVE it. Really awesome for my 21 year old cat who needs extra liquid in his diet. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Montana26

customer_reviews.title: A great product for kitties!
customer_reviews.text: We give these to our 4 cats and they all like them. If we just empty the pouch, they lick up the broth and leave the hard food behind. This seems to be pretty common. We’ve started to mix it with other soft food they like and we mash up the pieces with a fork. The end result is that they usually eat everything. So, something to try. But all in all, a great product for kitties.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Danville

customer_reviews.title: My cats got fishy mouth after eating it
customer_reviews.text: I might ask for too much. The product itself is great, but I ended up choosing a different product as my regulars because the other one, in my opinion, is better. My cats basically eat everything, so it's hard to tell whether treats have good flavor. However, after he ate this treat, his mouth tended to be a little stinky. Also, comparing to other products at the same price range, the content seems a little lean.
customer_reviews.author: Boyang Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Portion size is just right
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love the flavor but never ever eat the chunks of fish in there. I always wonder way. It seems to me, they could do with more liquid than the chunks. I do love the size but hate the tearing of the upper size of the envelop. Some times it seems too hard and I make a mess when it just tears off and a jet of the liquid flies away to any possible counter, mirror or any other thing I have on the counters. Please do not get me wrong, every thing is perfect just the small cutoff notch in the edges of the nicely packed boxes is kind of small.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Saldarriaga

customer_reviews.title: My rescue cat Cali - Loves her Fancy Feast!
customer_reviews.text: I rescued a tortie - 9 year old cat and she would only eat the dry food. I tried several other brands and when I came upon this brand, she immediately loved it. She will only eat this brand along with her dry cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse BJ

customer_reviews.title: The only wet food her majesty will eat.
customer_reviews.text: This is our kitty's absolute favorite wet food. In fact, she will eat no other, not even other flavors of the Fancy Feast Broths. I am happy to have come across this product, because our aging cat needs protein in its natural form to stay as healthy as possible in her waning years. We give her a packet of this food each day, and she does not let us forget to do so!
customer_reviews.author: Honey🍯Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Winston Henry Declares it's Delicious
customer_reviews.text: My big orange boy likes this. I like the convenience of the pouches. Sometimes I have to get a spoon to get all of the chunks out of the bottom. It is a great consistency for mixing with an elderly cat's meds and for making prescribed food more palatable. If this is used as a meal, the serving is small for my big 14 pound orange boy. I have to give him 2 where a smaller cat would probably be okay with 1 per meal. I have this on subscription to keep me out of the stores.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Michael

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: My cat eats wet food, but will turn his nose up depending on which flavor I give him or the consistency or if it was cold or room temp, or who the hell knows. He's 17 and I still can't figure him out. However, he needs to take thyroid medicine twice a day, so I crush it in his wet food and hope he eats it. Sometimes he does...but then I tried this stuff and HE'S. ALL. FOR. IT. It's pricey, but this cat is taking his meds like a champ. If you need to get your cat to eat, this is probably your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: aim1030

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product for picky cats
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen this gravy formula by Fancy Feast. Fancy Feast is the only wet cat food my cats will eat. My picky cat, would only lick the gravy out of the usual cans I purchased. He likes this better than anything else I've given him because of the gravy. It does have a small amount of meat in the gravy, and they come in pouches. I wish the pouches were recyclable like the cans, though.
customer_reviews.author: PurrCat

customer_reviews.title: All four cats go crazy over them! Good for seniors.
customer_reviews.text: We started buying this to supplement our senior cats diet, and in particular to help keep our 12 year old with some health problems well hydrated. All four cats love it, and really go for the broth. I also use it as a reward in the morning after the asthma inhaler (bad aftertaste) and to slip small pill pockets into for other meds. Anyway, all four love these broths, so far, have only tried the fishy ones. Will keep buying - not as expensive as some and high marks from the cats.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dukes

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled cats at my house!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only cat food with the exception of kibble my 2 spoiled Persians eat. They love the broth but most of the time leave the solid. The packets are really small, sometimes there is only a tablespoon in them which is not acceptable. But when you have spoiled cats that would rather starve, I go ahead and order this. It’s the same price on Chewy but easier through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that has an very sensitive stomach. At one point we thought we thought we were going to have to put her down. I tried these broths. They worked!!!! My cat LOVES the flavor. A tad bit expensive. 75 cents a package would be so much better. I would love to see Purina come out with a container of just broth.
customer_reviews.author: Just MeTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Tired of cat cans? This is your New Cat can.
customer_reviews.text: My cats no longer accepted cat cans, they would eat half of one for 4 cats. Which says hey this tastes like crap. Ever since I tried this broth with their morning food they all wake me up before 8am, all four mind you, just to get some of this fancy broth. With each of my cats having majorly different personalities and have them all beg for this treat it has to be a 10/10. One complaint, is that sometimes I need to scrape all the fish bits into the plate, it should all come out together. Other then that a delight.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: really great wet treat for cats
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this for over a year now because my cat got tired of his previous wet food treat. He gobbles this as soon as I set down his saucer down. I thought he might not be getting enough food because of the way he scarfs this but the vet said he is at a perfect weight for a senior cat. I appreciate that there are different varieties so between the creamy and non creamy varieties I don't think he'll get tired of this anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are great for any cat, but especially sick or older cats. I have a very sick cat and he cant eat dry food or canned food. The vet said as long as he can eat I can keep him around a bit longer. I bought these out of desperation. He's eaten 5 pouches just today. They are small enough not to upset his stomach but light enough to keep down. He is after all 17 and an old cat now, but I'm buying more and making sure I have some on hand if another cat needs or wants some
customer_reviews.author: Lildear

customer_reviews.title: Cats loved it but too pricey
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to the dry cat food i feed my colony of feral cats. I feed 6 friendly feral cats and they loved this soupy mixture mixed in with their dry food. It has pieces of real looking chicken and veggies and smell is not as bad as wet can food. My cats LOVED this broth! The only problem is, is that its a very small portion, only enough broth to feed 1 cat in each small pouch and aside from that its very expensive for such a small portion. So i won't be purchasing this anymore since it cost too much for me to feed 6 feral cats.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Shadow loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat Shadow loves this food! He likes wet food with gravy so I thought I would try these since his normal wet food is out of stock [thanks Covid-19] and he licks the bowl clean every time! The one with anchovies has actual whole small anchovies in it.. i was impressed. This food is ACTUALLY food not some ground up pate paste. If you want to give your feline friend a real treat get them this!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Brown

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat really loves this creamy broth. She licks all the broth, but leaves the meats. I don't know why, as the fish looks high quality, but that's OK, as a feral cat I feed totally loves the fish, so none goes to waste. My cat gets this every morning, as an appetizer, and a couple hours later she gets her regular canned and dry food. My cat has pancreatitis and this broth really helps for her first morning into her meals that follow the rest of the day.
customer_reviews.author: boo

customer_reviews.title: Appetite stimulation - Check ;* licks4life :)
customer_reviews.text: My 18 year old cat won't eat the solids but his appetite has returned with these sauces. I add touch of water after emptying the pack to get all the product for him . Sauces stimulate his appetite to start his day - he even seems more affectionate. We have been feeding him these for 3 months effectively taking him from a gaunt senior, to a healthy weight ! Licks 4 life!
customer_reviews.author: Tuesday Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Don’t panic, be patient, your cat will let you know the truth.
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on ordering the fancy feast broth treat because the Hartz Stew treat was not available and I cannot get out to shop. He licked a small amount of the broth and walked away. I tried a 2nd pack and chopped up the chunks of meat, no dice 3rd pack he just sniffed and tried to cover it up with scratching motions. What a desperate mistake I made and the fancy feast was way more expensive than his favorite. I think a refund is in order. Thank you, Jo Ann French
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann French

customer_reviews.title: Cats Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: Whoa! My cats really love this stuff! I use it to dissolve and serve Viralys powder. First I tried "Li'l Soups" and my cats went crazy. Then I decided to try this, for something a little different, and we've reached a new level of obsession. They wolf this stuff down like their lives depend on it! They beg for it every morning. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: My cats aren't allergic to this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought another brand of liquid treat for my cat. He ended up scratching his face and chin to the point of getting scabs to cover up where he had scratched himself raw. The vet told me that cats scratch around their face when they are allergic to something. So I started feeding him these treats, and the scabs and scratching have gone away.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: A good way to give medicine to finicky felines
customer_reviews.text: I have to give medicine to my cat every day. I strain the liquid broth from the meat, mix with her crushed meds (about 2 cc of the liquid broth) and administer to her via a tiny syringe. I have been using the Fancy Feast Broth for this purpose for about 4 years now. It is perfect. Just store the extra broth in a small container in the fridge again for use the next day.
customer_reviews.author: carnation

customer_reviews.title: Smashed
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in bottom of a large box with several heavy items on top all out of box smashed in bottom of box ! They should know better than to put something like this under heavy items. For the most part I use these on a sickly kitty that won't eat any regular food as they are quite expensive for the tiny amount that comes in these . Some of the cats like the broth but don't like the solid matter in these? Not sure why it seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Curious714

customer_reviews.title: McDonald's For Cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this stuff. I put extra water in it to help hydrate him and make each portion last a little longer. He also gets his meds mixed in and I know he gets his full dose because he always cleans his plate. It also doesn't smell like death in a can like most cat food products do. Much appreciated, Fancy Feast. The tuna is the only flavor he likes. Cats.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it but for the quantity the price covers the ...
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive. Cats like it but for the quantity the price covers the expensive packaging and contents are slim. Not buying again, good stuff but too much money for doll house contents.
customer_reviews.author: Henri Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!
customer_reviews.text: My finicky cat decided she wanted to start eating wet food again! But, not any wet food, she has to have something that is mostly gravy! Usually she licks the gravy up and leaves the meat. This time around with eating the wet food, she has actually been eating the meat! I chop it up really fine with a spoon. She first licks up the gravy then returns later for the meat!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Bee

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite treat!
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves these broths. She's the type who will lick all the gravy from the wet food and leave the rest, so these are perfect for her since they're mostly liquid/broth! She goes crazy when I grab the box to take a pouch out and will keep meowing until I put the bowl down in front of her. These are a definite keeper in our home!
customer_reviews.author: ChalmondFashew

customer_reviews.title: There is barely anything in the packets. Please don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: The price is ridiculous for what little you get in each packet. This is straight-up like rich people food, where they pay $18 for 3 jumbo shrimp and if you complain, it means you aren't a "rich person", so nobody speaks up about how ridiculous the price vs amount is. I have other Purina products, but this one is just pathetic and has made me doubt them.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this product, Fancy Feast Broths. It comes in handy packets which is just the right size serving. I have 4 cats, 2 of which are very senior cats and this is a good product because it is easy for them to chew. One of these cats has dental problems and has had extractions so I really like this product as he has no issues chewing it. Overall, this is a great product and I am so happy that my cats love this.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Husemann

customer_reviews.title: My cat's favorite wet treat
customer_reviews.text: My cats loves these treat packs. They ask for them daily, but I give it to them every couple of days because one of my cats is prone to gaining weight easily. My other cat has a chicken allergy so the fact that these don't have that in the ingredients at all is perfect. It's hard to come across any cat food or treat that doesn't have chicken in it. I'm thankful for these and so are my fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoely Rivera

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that has always required a special diet. She loves the broths. Since using these broths over a year ago, her stomach issues have improved 100%. She licks these broths up like candy. So happy they came out with a 16 count box. She would eat these all day long and nothing else if I'd let her.
customer_reviews.author: Just MeTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat always ate the gravy & left the rest of the contents so I was very happy to find this product! The pouch is challenging to get everything out of, even using a utensil, but I believe most of the gravy part comes out ok. I gave 4 stars for portion size, I feel like there could be more in there for the price.
customer_reviews.author: tltovey

customer_reviews.title: In our case the food didn't agree with her stomach . She vomited it  Perhaps too rich don't know.
customer_reviews.text: The food din't agree with her stomach. I think it was good, smelled delicious but just alittle too rich for her. Please don't send us any more. Thanks you.
customer_reviews.author: LoLoWeb2

customer_reviews.title: End of life care broth.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to spoil my cat during his last days. Before he gave up eating he choose to drink the broth of foods he enjoyed theses I’m glad he got some thing he enjoyed for his last days with us.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Orlando

customer_reviews.title: Kitties favorite treat
customer_reviews.text: These are on the expensive side, but great for a special treat a few times a week. They lap it right up. The only issue I have, but it the same with all cat food pouches, is that it is hard to get it all out. Also it always ends up on my hands. I put a little warm water into the package to get out all the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES these broths. Portion size is perfect for what it is, a treat, not a meal. Her fave is the mackerel but of course that’s the hardest to find. I just wish there was some other way to package these products. So much plastic. Kitty only gets these a couple of times a week for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: KellyK

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these.
customer_reviews.text: My cats are enthusiastic connoisseurs of these broths. I was asked to rate the flavors but my cats refused to discuss this aspect of the product. However, my deductions based on daily observation lead me to believe they find the flavors most palatable. They have been consuming them for a number of years and reliably clean their plates. This is a solid five star product.
customer_reviews.author: Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has an extremely sensitive stomach. She is lactose intolerant which I laughed considering she is a cat? She had diarrhea. I was constantly having to pull out my carpet cleaner. Sigh. I tried this broth. She loves the broth. It's wonderful we can purchase these in a 16 pack. The 16 pack price is more affordable. The broth is easy on her stomach. Thank you Purina!
customer_reviews.author: Just MeTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: All the cats love this broth
customer_reviews.text: So far none of the flavors I've bought (and I've bought more then a few) had been rejected! I use this to make sure 2 of my cats get their meds (blood pressure, and asthma) since I don't want to waste medicine they need to have daily I need to use something they are going to eat all of, and these boths are it. I usually use 1 packet across 2 days, put remaining broth in a plastic ziplock and store in fridge. I use a spoon to get everything out of the packet, it's pretty easy so no complaints about the packaging. It is definitly worth the price to make sure my fur babys get their meds.
customer_reviews.author: Melody C.

customer_reviews.title: My old cat loves these
customer_reviews.text: Careful when opening, it can be difficult to open and be messy. I use scissors to open the pouches, that makes it a lot easier. Sometimes I give one or two pouches to my cat as is. Other times I will pour this over some other canned cat food just to give her extra juice. She loves the juice and she loves this broth.
customer_reviews.author: InYourCloset

customer_reviews.title: YUM for cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES these -- so of course, I do, too! I would have easily given 5 stars, but it's very difficult to get the small bits of solid food out of the packets. The folds at the bottom make it stand up nicely, but pieces of meat and/or veggies get stuck in the folds. If the packaging were changed to make dispensing more complete, this would be a big-time winner with my cat and me! Of course, the price could be lower, too...but it's so nice to have something I know my cat will EAT -- not just sniff and lick a couple of times and walk away! She licks the plate clean pretty much every time!
customer_reviews.author: Type O

customer_reviews.title: Happy kitties!
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a late-night or mid-afternoon treat. My guys have dry food out all the time, and each get a half can of Fancy Feast breakfast and dinner, but if they’ve finished and are letting me know they need something else, I give them each a packet. This goes over very well in my house! As long as they stay a healthy weight, I have no problem with this. It is a little pricey, but my guys are adopted from less than ideal circumstances, so I’ve taken the responsibility of spoiling them!
customer_reviews.author: Nondairy

customer_reviews.title: Great for constipated cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was constantly getting constipated & started pooping on the rug. I added one pack of these a day to his wet food & it worked like magic. No more pooping on the rug & he's much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Pandora the kitty gives it 4 paws up!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty Pandora wasn’t eating well so I purchased this asa supplement to add to her food. I warmed it up just a little and put it on the plate then added her canned food on top. She gobbled it up as soon as she smelled it. I am so happy that she eats it eagerly with no problem!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: My cat would kill a man for these things.
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap my cat loves these stupid things. The second he sees the packaging he screams until I feed it to him. I think I could put this on top of feces and he would still eat it. The little packages are annoying to open and even more annoying to emptying out, but I guess it’s worth it because he loves it so much. Love that it’s pretty low calorie, too.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Good for finicky eaters
customer_reviews.text: I had a very sick cat and this was one way I was able to get her to eat. Now I use them as an evening treat for one of our cats. It's a little pricey as an every-day treat, but he loves it. You don't get a lot in each packet, but that makes it the perfect size for a treat - not a meal.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Weitze

customer_reviews.title: Picky cat approved
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very picky and randomly decides that his favorite flavors aren't food anymore on a rotating basis. I've been mixing these in to avoid wasting tons of cat food, and it works like a charm. Of course now I'm being extorted for broths, but as long as he eats we both win.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She likes it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a very picky eater when it comes to wet food, but she loves this stuff, especially the seafood-only kinds. I get two servings out of each packet. I put half the packet on a saucer and then add about a tablespoon of water to it. She laps up every drop, which makes me feel better about her hydration level. Cats often don’t drink very much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these cat food. When I get up in the morning they follow me around until I read them. They know every morning I give them Fancy Feast Broth and they can not wait. My husband laugh at how they follow me all over the house until I give them their Fancy Feast.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Pricey
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan! The lesser ingredient packages seemed to be more prevalent. Mackerel with veggies had more than the salmon one inthe box I have opened. My cat loves these but mostly the salmon one. It is very pricey & I want the better ingredients which is considerably more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Nebraska girl

customer_reviews.title: Of course the cats like this!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15 year old cat and old cats need lots of liquid in their diet to keep their kidneys healthy. These packets are perfect. The cat loves them, and they are are not a bad buy. They are very handy if you have a busy life and need to get your cats to eat more liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Stevens

product_meta.title: Purina Fancy Feast Broths Adult Wet Cat Food Complement
product_meta.description: Color:Tuna, Shrimp & Whitefish| Size:(16) 1.4 oz. Pouches| Style:ClassicCreate a gourmet dining experience for your darling cat with Purina Fancy Feast Broths Classic With Tuna, Shrimp & Whitefish Gourmet cat complement. Morsels of real tuna, shrimp and whitefish combine in this wet cat food complement to offer the delicate seafood flavors cats love, and the decadent, silky broth is sure to have her lapping up every last mouthwatering drop. We make this soft cat food complement with real, recognizable ingredients you can see, so you can feel good about offering it to your feline friend. With the unmistakable taste and tender texture your cat craves, this simply crafted recipe is a true feast for her senses. Serve a pouch of this delectable gourmet cat food complement daily as an addition to your cat's complete and balanced cat food diet, and watch as she delights in the lickable, savory broth and hand-selected ingredients found in every bite. Order this Purina wet cat food complement at Amazon.com today, and let your cat know how much you love her.
feature_bullets: Sixteen (16) 1.4 oz. Pouches - Purina Fancy Feast Broth Wet Cat Food Complement, Broths With Tuna, Shrimp & Whitefish
Wet cat food made with real, hand-selected tuna, shrimp and whitefish
Natural wet cat food made without by-products or fillers
Silky, decadent broth for added flavor and moisture
Intended as a complement to your cat's complete and balanced diet

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
